Odločajo o princesini prištevnosti
Mnogi menijo, da po kapi ne more več skrbeti za svoje premoženje. Havajčanka in njena žena se s tem ne strinjata.
01 Nov 2019, 07:22 by B. K. P.



Abigail sta na sodišču spremljali njena žena in njuna čivava.



Iz princesinega sklada se financirajo mnogi projekti, zato ljudem ni vseeno, kaj se dogaja z denarjem. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images


Triindevetdesetletna havajska princesa Abigail Kawananakoa se je morala zglasiti na sodišču, kjer odločajo, ali je po kapi, ki jo je doživela leta 2017, dovolj prištevna, da sama upravlja svoje premoženje, ki znaša vrtoglavih 195 milijonov evrov. Podobnih obravnav se je udeleževala že lani, ko je sodnik odločil, da ni sposobna odločati o tem, kako in za kaj bo porabila denar, ter o tem, kdo naj bogastvo podeduje.


Iz princesinega sklada se financirajo mnogi projekti, zato ljudem ni vseeno, kaj se dogaja z denarjem. FOTO: Guliver/Getty Images

Takrat so za skrbnika njenih milijonov določili eno od havajskih bank, nad čimer pa princesa ni bila niti malo navdušena, saj je prepričana, da je povsem sposobna odločati o tem, kako bo porabila svoj denar. 
Žena naj bi jo izkoriščala
Princesa ima sicer tudi poseben odbor, ki ji svetuje in pomaga, a niti z njihovimi odločitvami ni zadovoljna. Člani odbora so namreč prepričani, da je 93-letnica povsem pod vplivom svoje 66-letne žene Veronice Gail Worth, ta pa naj bi jo izkoriščala in brezglavo zapravljala njen denar, ki ga je princesa podedovala kot prapravnukinja Jamesa Campbella, irskega poslovneža, ki je obogatel kot lastnik plantaže sladkornega trsa.Da jo žena izkorišča, že ves čas trdi njen nekdanji odvetnik Jim Wright, ki se zavzema za to, da bi kot skrbnika premoženja določili njega. Worthova, ki je na sodišču spremljala dedinjo, pa meni, da bi Wright rad postal skrbnik samo zato, da bi lahko izkoriščal princeso in zapravljal njen denar. Z njo se strinja tudi princesin novi zagovornik Bruce Voss: »Res je, da ima gospa Kawananakoa veliko premoženja in da veliko ljudi misli, da bodo njen denar vlagali bolje od nje. A to ne pomeni, da lahko gospa Kawananakoa izgubi osnovno pravico do odločanja, kaj želi storiti s svojim denarjem in lastnino.« Ali bo sodnik letos odločil v njen prid, bo znano predvidoma čez en mesec.
195 milijonov evrov je vredno princesino premoženje.
Gospa sicer ni modre krvi. Havajci jo imajo za princeso, ker je potomka družine, ki je temu ameriškemu otočju vladala do leta 1893, ko so tamkajšnjo kraljevino ukinili. In zakaj se o njenem denarju, podedovanem ali ne, odloča na sodišču? Od njenih milijonov imajo prebivalci veliko koristi, saj je princesa ustanovila sklad za financiranje raznih projektov na otočju, in če zmanjka njenega denarja, lahko mnogi od njih propadejo.

They decide on the princess's appropriateness
Many feel that he can no longer take care of his property after a stroke. The Hawaiian and her wife disagree.
01 Nov 2019, 07:22 by B. K. P.



Abigail was accompanied in court by her wife and their chihuahua.



Many projects are funded by the Princess Fund, so people do not care what is happening with the money. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images


Ninety-three-year-old Hawaiian princess Abigail Kawananakoa has had to plead in court to decide whether she is fit enough to manage her assets of a dizzying € 195 million after a stroke she suffered in 2017. She attended similar hearings last year when a judge ruled that she was incapable of deciding how and for what she would spend the money, and who should inherit the fortune.


Many projects are funded by the Princess Fund, so people do not care what is happening with the money. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty Images

At the time, they appointed one of the Hawaiian banks as the guardian of her millions, and the princess was not a little impressed, as she was convinced that she was fully capable of deciding how she would spend her money.
The wife is supposed to exploit her
The Princess also has a special committee to advise and assist her, but she is not happy with their decisions either. Board members are convinced that the 93-year-old is utterly influenced by her 66-year-old wife, Veronica Gail Worth, who is about to exploit her and headlessly waste her money, which the princess inherited as the great-granddaughter of James Campbell, an Irish businessman who enriched as the owner of the sugarcane plantation.As his wife, Jim Wright, maintains that his wife is taking advantage of her, she is committed to designating him as the property trustee. Worth, who has accompanied her inheritance in court, believes that Wright would like to become a guardian just so he could exploit the princess and waste her money. She also agrees with Princess 'new advocate Bruce Voss:' It is true that Mrs Kawananakoa has a lot of assets and that many people think that her money will be better invested than hers. But that does not mean that Mrs Kawananakoa may lose the basic right to decide what she wants to do with her money and property. ”Whether a judge decides this year in her favor will be known in a month.
€ 195 million is princess property.
Madam, otherwise there is no blue blood. The Hawaiians consider her a princess because she is a descendant of a family that ruled the United States until 1893, when the kingdom was abolished there. And why is her money, inherited or not, decided in court? There are many benefits to its millions as the princess has set up a fund to finance various projects in the islands, and if she runs out of money, many of them may collapse.
